NH Carlton Amsterdam
7.4 Very good
Based on 240 reviews

The hotel is centrally located right next to the famous flower market and to Kalverstraat, the main shopping street.

My room was on the 7th floor, with a fantastic view over Mint Tower. The room was quite spacious, with a closet for clothes and a big bathroom. Being on the top floor, the street noise did not disturb me (the sound of the tower bells might be an issue for light sleepers though) but as the area around the hotel is very lively, it could be a problem in lower floor rooms. The room had tea-making facilities. Free wi-fi is now available in the hotel rooms as well as in the lobby - a password is valid for 24 hours. It was a bit slow but that could have been due to many people using it at night and in the morning. The downside was that, as many other reviews said, the furnishings looked a bit dated. The white curtains were dusty - if they have to be white, they should perhaps be washed more often. The efficiency of the daily cleaning service seemed to alternate depending on the particular person who did it - some of them did choose to clean the bathtub and the sink, others did not. All things considered, go for an upgraded room on an upper floor, and you'll be fine.

Show more
Svetlana , Russia
Dorint Airport Hotel Amsterdam
8 Very good
Based on 233 reviews

The room size was a little small with lots of dirt and stains on the carpet. there were tiny hairs on the carpet.

I assume, they have not vacuumed the floors in a long time. The room had a strange, musky smell, I guess it was coming from the carpet. We had a terrible experience in this hotel. Because, we had not managed to see most of Amsterdam, we decided to extend our stay there. We chose this hotel because of the price and the convenience of the shuttle service to the train station. However, after extending and informing the front desk of our extension, we then left to go to the city. when we returned to the hotel, we found over room 'ransacked'. All our belongings were crudely and roughly, packed into our suitcases and left on the baggage trolley ( like the ones you get from the supermarket). We were horrified when we saw this. We then approached the front desk to inquire about our unpleasant experience. The front desk staff was very apologetic and informed us that the system was not updated with our extension of stay. We were then asked to move to another room (which did not have the foul odour). The swimming pool was more for kids. There was a swimming instructor who was collecting fees and teaching kids to swim in that pool. It looked as if, they were on an arranged schedule and this prevented us from using the pool. The only thing we enjoyed in this hotel was the breakfast which had a wide election of food and the service here was good.

Show more
Usha , Malaysia
Hotel Estherea
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 176 reviews

From the minute you enter the hotel, you are met with luxury coupled with efficiency. The hotel staff were extremely welcoming, and it provided a peaceful haven after walking around Amsterdam! We booked the cheapest room, but in no way was this basic.

It was very well appointed, tastefully decorated, and the bathroom was huge! The coffee machine in reception provided extremely good coffee, wouldn't have guessed it was from a machine, and there were also chocolates, sweets and cookies available. All in all, this hotel provided a wonderful base for exploring Amsterdam. It was easy to find, right on the Singel canal, and I would definately stay there again. I cannot recommend it too much! I did not try the breakfast, so therefore cannot comment, but it did look good

Show more
Lee , United Kingdom
Cordial Hotel Dam Square
7.1 Very good
Based on 97 reviews

Me and my partner visited amsterdam for 3 days - awesome experience! The hotel was roughly 4/5 min walk from Dam square and RLD Most well known coffee shops were within easy walking distance from the hotel The staff were pleasant respectful and very helpful, they also allowed us to leave our luggage after check out as we had a late flight home They provided housekeeping throughout our stay and we experienced some leaniancy with their smoking rules which made our stay feel very accommodating and comfortable as tourist The room was small room and had no view the bins in the lift area could of been changed a bit more often but it was generally clean, seemed to be great value for money and we would be happy to use this hotel in the future Would recommend staying on the 2nd floor or above

Sharna , United Kingdom
NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
8.2 Excellent
Based on 376 reviews

Firstly, the location is superb. Right in Damn Square. It is also an iconic well known hotel. But pass through the door and expect the unexpected.

Check-in was OK, although trying to find someone in the lobby to help find a powder room was a challenge. The room was in the new block, and the corridor was like a sci-fi time tunnel, with bright lights tripping on by sensor. No problem though. The room? Clean and reasonable, but plenty of corners cut. The shower was feeble, to say the least. Plugs randomly placed (none for the kettle except on the floor). The facilities were basic, and I am not too sure about the bathroom separation from main room by just frosted glass. Wifi was ok, and free, despite strong offers to buy “premium”. It wasn’t bad or anything, just that the cut corners were a bit annoying. We didn’t bother with food in there: too expensive compared to outside. Ditto breakfast. Example of the bizarre? 8am Sunday, fire alarm. A loud Dutch tannoy voice, barking orders we didn’t understand. We thought it was a bust with cops and guns outside our door. Scary, even though we had nothing to hide. We came out to see other bewildered gusts, and the fire door had bolted shut, so the only escape was the fire exit. We went down there and busted our way out. We then walked around the front of the building and through the main door. It was as if nothing had happened! We went to the lobby man, who said: not their fault because a Spanish ship’s captain had showered with the bathroom door open, and the steam had set the alarm off. Seriously. He really said that, shrugging his shoulders, saying they (the hotel) had to put up with it too. So folks, DON’T leave the shower door open, and hope no-one else does! This could be a great hotel if they got their act together, stopped cutting stupid corners with the rooms, and tried harder. Staff were ok, but the attitude from above probably sets the scene. But: iconic hotel, the advantages of large hotel, 10/10 location.

Show more
Stephen , United Kingdom
Bastion Hotel Amsterdam Airport
7.8 Very good
Based on 259 reviews

Lime any airport hotel, most travellers are arriving long haul and/or checking out early.unliunlike any other airport hotel, the cleaners don't even arrive until 10:30 AM, which means a weary traveller must wait for hours in a crowded lobby, even when the guests have been bussed to the airport hours before.

Worse, the hotel has discounted contracts with cruise ship employees, and so the lobby is full of philppinos, Indonesians, etc, for hours - who then are checked in 2 to a room before full fare customers, each required ng more paperwork. A tedious experience. Customer interaction revolves around ' it's not my fault': I sent an email asking about directions which, 3 days after leaving, remains unanswered. Never again.

Show more
John , Ireland
Swissôtel Amsterdam
8.4 Excellent
Based on 254 reviews

at the end of our stay, one reception staff was rude when i clarified the instructions left by our uber driver, she took the call of our uber driver but failed to get the instructions fr driver properly.

also, good thing i reviewed our invoice properly, the staff charged 200 something euro supposedly for a transportation some 4 girls hired amd charged in our room. when i argued that it was just me and my husband staying in the room and our companions have their own, they seem to be puzzled. i think its the reception's job to familiarize themselves with their guests, the hotel is not that big anyways or if they can't do so, they can always verify the room check info of guests before allowing room charges. saves a lot of time upon check out. over all stay was pleasant. - jaime's wife

Show more
jaime , Philippines
Novotel Amsterdam City
8.1 Excellent
Based on 182 reviews

absolutely we are coming back to this hotel when we are going to amsterdam. in fact we are planning to go to amsterdam with our kids soon and definitely this will be the hotel of our choice.

near rai station and only need 5 minutes walking. taking tram will need about 20 minutes to reach central station in amsterdam or about 10 minutes by train/subway. there are taxis always stand by in front of the hotel and make much more convenience for transport. very convenience even the hotel is not in the center and we prefer to stay here as those hotels in the center will not have such facilities that this hotel can offered. the breakfast is absolutely the best you can get in amsterdam and it has been our most favourite part of the hotel. huge selections and even the best cup noodle that we ever taste. we love this selection after travelling for over a week in eu. definitely a great hotel with the best breakfast for any travellers to amsterdam. no doubt about that. i am very happy that i choose this hotel for our first time stay in amsterdam.

Show more
Soerianto , Indonesia
Van der Valk Hotel Schiphol A4-Amsterdam Airport
8.1 Excellent
Based on 656 reviews

1) Not that close to the airport - EUR40 in a taxi! 2) Billed as a 4 star however the room had - no minibar (you had to go to reception and purchase a minibar box - which means you are paying for a load of items you don't even want - no kettle (we needed to sterilise some baby bottles so had to pay EUR15 to hire one) - no toiletries other than soap, shampoo and shower gel 3) The room was suffocatingly hot and stuffy and we were unable to reduce the temperature other than by opening the doors 4) I had to pay EUR10 for a plug adaptor 5) We were told to buy water from the vending machines (which were out of water) and that the nearest shop was at the airport 6) We had a conversation at check in on whether to get the shuttle or a taxi back to the airport - at no point during which was it mentioned we needed to reserve a place on the shuttle bus Overall - not a hideous place to stay but definitely not a 4*.

On the plus side the restaurant was good.

Show more
Catherine , United Kingdom
ibis Amsterdam Airport
7.6 Very good
Based on 455 reviews

It was poor, Under ibis normal standards. 1st I book 2 standards double room for 4 people. at the checkin we arrive at 11pm it was late and we have to wait almost 40 mins to check in, I book through agoda and i never have a problem, The staff said they only have 1 room from my booking , so they put us in the 1 room for 4 people, but the gave us free breakfast instead I didn't complain, and then when we check out, I check my credit card bill, I was charge 145 euros for something, I send the email of my creditcard bill to the manager, and I got a refund back, but from my point of view it is under the ibis standards.

Thanathip , Thailand
NH Collection Amsterdam Barbizon Palace
8 Very good
Based on 299 reviews

My expectations were high from the pictures of the hotel. I knew it was an old building & that's why I selected it, but the conditions of the rooms were disappointing.

We arrived at the hotel after a long overnight flight at 11:00am only to be told that the rooms are not going to be available before 3:00pm. Our cries to the front desk staff went unheard. We were tried & the weather was very cold but we were left in the cold until 3:00 pm. Other rooms were available with single beds , we requested double beds, but were not given to us until our rooms were available. I have travelled throughout the world, but this was a first. When we got to the rooms, they were clean but old. the pillows were terrible, very lumpy & uncomfortable. The beds were fine as long as laid in the middle. The room furniture was outdated, scratches & fabric cuts are normal.TV was outdated, boxy & to top it all with bad reception. The second day I wanted to rent a pay TV as advertised in the TV, I was told my room's TV did not have a pay TV! II had to change the room to get a Pay TV instead of changing the TV itself!!! The concierge Staff was the only person that was very attentive & help put us at ease. Thanks.

Show more
Adil , Qatar
Ramada Apollo Amsterdam Centre Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 378 reviews

This hotel made an excellent first impression with the free airport transfer and extremely polite and helpful driver.

The subsequent check-in and customer service was atrocious, sadly. I don't use a credit card, and informed the receptionist on check-in when one was requested for 'extras.' This is standard in hotels and most are ok to waive the fee or to accept it in cash. Unfortunately, I had just arrive on a long flight from the middle-east and had no cash on me. The receptionist informed me I could not check-in and would have to walk to the nearest ATM, fifteen minutes away to get cash for her. I appealed to hotel management and was allowed to check-in on the proviso that I pay cash later that day. The receptionist advised me 'not to forget' when I went to my room, and when I was leaving felt the need to call out to me to bring the money later. It felt like a loan-shark operation, as well as being extraordinarily rude. I returned and paid the cash. I was awoken at 06:00 by a letter, written by the manager, being slipped under my door advising me that my room-key would be deactivated and I would be asked to leave the hotel if I did not pay the deposit. Of course, I had already paid, and the room itself was pre-paid. The contempt and rudeness shown to me I couldn't quite comprehend, and asked a staff member to dispose of the letter later which they did, apologising, off-the-record, for the manager's rudeness. Finally, dining-options are a vending machine and a variety of snacks kept behind reception. It's a forty minute walk from the hotel to the centre, which I really enjoyed. For most this is a bit out of the way. There is an efficient and regular tram which will take you on purchase of a daily pass for 8 euro. Overall, I would thoroughly recommend giving this one a miss as the manager has no understanding of civil guest relations.

Show more
Gary , United Kingdom
ibis Amsterdam Centre
7.5 Very good
Based on 610 reviews

The location is definitely a plus as it is just a 3-minute walk from the main Central Station (don't worry, you won't be disturbed by the train as the window is soundproofed).

Great for family with big luggage and for those who plan to move around Europe. Moreover, the staff were all friendly and accommodating. However, keep in mind that the standard room does not include a kettle (you can upgrade your room for additional amenities). No toothbrush in the bathroom, but they have the 3-in-1 shower, face, and body shower gel. Free wifi and it works throughout the hotel. All in all, we had a great stay. Definitely recommended.

Show more
Muhamad , Malaysia
Amsterdam Teleport Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 139 reviews

Pros - Staff is very friendly & helpful. The nearest Sloterdijk station has tram no 12 to Museumplein, bus no 22 to central amsterdam (taking about 20-30min) and also train directly to Amsterdam Central station which is quite convenient.

The buses to Amsterdam Central comes very frequent, makes travelling very easy. The room is very clean and tidy. Check in and out is very easy too. The hotel allow luggage storage after checking out which is another plus point as our flight is at night. Cons - wifi is kinda weak at upper floor and room is rather stuffy even with window. My personal opinion is this hotel is located quite a walking distance from the Sloterdijk station (appx. 10 min). It can be quite taxing for guests who carry big luggages.

Show more
Pueoh , Malaysia
Best Western Zaan Inn
8.3 Excellent
Based on 150 reviews

This hotel is only 2 Train Stop away from Amsterdam Central Station (< 12 mins) cost Euro2.70 with OV Chipkaart.

Without OV Chipkart will cost you Euro1 extra. If you are staying at this hotel, I would recommend you to get the OV Chipkaart which cost Euro7.50 (un-refundable). Your card must always be reloaded with at least Euro20 if you are taking the train. This credit can always be refunded at the airport or any other train station with counter service. Euro1 admin fee will be charged for the refund process. The refund process is fast and in cash as long as the credit in your card does not exceed Euro30. This hotel is only 400m away from Zaandam Train Station. From the platform go upstairs, turn right then down the escalator. Once at the street level, make a SHARP right (NOT straight out then right). Walking down you will see Deen Supermarket along your way before you reach the Hotel. Deen Supermarket is only 1 min walk away from this Hotel. This is a big supermarket and I always get my daily necessity from there. It is very convenient and also 1 of my major reason why I choose this Hotel. This hotel is actually situated in Zaandam, not Amsterdam. Personally after visited these places, I find myself prefer Zaandam more than Amsterdam. Zaandam is a very peaceful and quiet city. Amsterdam is too crowded for me. If you are exiting the Zaandam Train Station from the left exit, you will be amaze with it's beautiful shopping district. You can spend half day there at least. There is also a big supermarket there called Albert Heijn. From Zaandam Station, you can actually easily access to many other well known attraction. Zaanse Schans (Windmill, Clog Workshop, Cheese Factory etc..) is only 2 Train Stop Away < 10 mins (Get off at Zoog-Zandijk Train Station). If you wish to visit Keukenhof (Tullips Farm), take a train from Zaandam Station and get off at Amsterdam Schiphol Airport Train Station 17 mins (3 Train Stop away) at Euro4.50. From the Airport, take direct shuttl

Show more
Kelly , Malaysia
Hyatt Regency Amsterdam
8.3 Excellent
Based on 5 reviews

easyHotel Amsterdam Zaandam
8.2 Excellent
Based on 87 reviews

The hotel was super close to the Zaandam train station, about a 2 minute walk, it was then a short train ride into the city centre and the frequency on the trains were every 5-10 minutes! The hotel was easy to find with the orange Easy Hotel banners outside and check in was smooth.

The room was clean and tidy, and we were lucky to have an excellent view over the Zaandam train station and pretty Inntel Hotel. There was free WIFI in the rooms along with smart TVs that offer screen sharing if you have the compatible tech, (great for putting films on your phone onto a bigger screen). Don't forget to check out the leaflets next to the desk as they offer lots of discount coupons for the museums and canal tours. The only minus point we found was not having tea making facilities in the room. Even if it was just a kettle and some cups we would have happily gone and got our own tea/coffee and milk. There was a snack and cold drink vending machine on the 10th floor and a hot drink vending machine on the ground floor. But one very very small coffee was €1.50! Overall I recommend this for short stays. As space in the room is limited and there is only a small space to hang a few items of clothes. But overall a very comfortable and calm stay.

Show more
natasha , United Kingdom
Best Western Amsterdam Airport Hotel
7.4 Very good
Based on 463 reviews

I stayed here for 1 night in transit through Amsterdam. It is close to the airport, and a free shuttle bus ride is only 10 minutes.

I checked in OK, room condition was OK, but an empty fridge for some reason and I was thirsty after a long journey. I went for a drink at the bar, waited about 10 minutes to be served by an angry and rude bar maid. I went for something to eat, nobody seemed interested in serving me, when I eventually did order my food, had to wait 30 minutes for it to come, ad restaurant wasn't even busy. Went for another drink at the bar and waited and waited to be served by the angry bar maid again. So I went to bed, the shuttle service begins in the morning at 6am, but can't have breakfast before as breakfast doesn't start until 6am too, which is so strange. So I went on the shuttle bus but realised I had left an item in my room, I asked the driver to wait so I can get my item, he said yes, when I returned he had drove off with my luggage on the bus!!!! It made me panic so much, about what would happen to my luggage. Fortunately a member off staff drove me to the airport and luckily the bus was there with my luggage. A rather cruel way to make a guest worry about there belongings. Rudest staff, worst service ever.

Show more
George , United Kingdom
Avenue Hotel
7.5 Very good
Based on 201 reviews

located a mere 5 minutes walk from amsterdam centraal train station and adjacent to the main stretch of damrak, avenue hotel is a perfect choice for a stay.

while the toilet was quite small, the room i was given is clean and of a nice size, although i would have liked a better view. the staff was really friendly and accommodating. when i needed to change my arrival dates (at the last minute and effectively cancelling one night of stay), the staff allowed this without penalty me which i really appreciated. i also liked that there was a computer terminal on the ground floor to check emails etc, especially useful for someone who does not travel with a laptop. all in all, i recommend this hotel to others :-)

Show more
Hamzah , Singapore
Hotel De Hallen
8.8 Excellent
Based on 119 reviews

All in all, we loved our stay and would definitely stay again and highly recommend. From the moment we arrived to the moment we checked out we felt so welcome and comfortable and looked after.

The rooms are very plush and comfortable, I slept incredibly well (and i'm a bad sleeper)! And i loved the coffee machines in room. We had intended to go find a restaurant for dinner but we were enjoying sitting in the lovely courtyard bit outside the bar having our complimentary cocktails (which were delicious) when an incredible looking burger was carried passed us by a waiter so we couldn't resist. My boyfriend even thinks they were the best burgers he has ever had! Technically they were on the lunch menu but the staff had no issue accommodating for dinner time and they were very reasonably priced. The hotel itself is in an old tram depo so is a really lovely space and we loved the style with several seating areas (and a swing). Despite its 'uber cool' style i found it had a really lovely atmosphere which made us feel very comfortable and we were more than happy to hang out in the communal areas. There are a couple of negatives however. It is still very new so upon our arrival we were surprised to find some areas outside the hotel still look like building sites. Not really an issue but it may bother some people. Also it is further outside of the city, this is actually why we booked it as we had tickets to a gig nearby but if you want to explore all of the city factor in that you will probably be getting the tram a lot (which is very easy, the stop is very close and again the hotel staff are very helpful advising the best way to navigate around) rather than walking. Again not a massive problem but something to bear in mind.

8.8 Excellent
Based on 44 reviews

We simply LOVE the Grand, and we even got married here! For our 3 year anniversary we decided to again stay here and it was truly unforgettable.

The staff is very attentive and help you out with everything you need. (Niels, thanks for all your help as always!) The rooms look beautiful, very luxurious (they've got Hermes products in the bathroom) and the little personal touches are just what makes this hotel stand out from all other 5 star hotels for me. The beds are by the way amazing, and we are now tempted to actually buy the bed (new of course) as that is an option they offer! I do advise to always ask for a room at a higher floor, because if you are close to the street it may be a bit noisy. Their courtyard garden is beautiful and had a very nice exhibition of beautiful statues this time. It is so peaceful and beautiful, you do not feel like you are in the middle of Amsterdam. But the highlight was the private dinner in the marriage chamber, which is where we got married 3 years ago. A pianist (Hester, thank you so much for the lovely music and great company) was beautifully playing and the room was full of candles. So romantic! We had an amazing 7 course dinner with accompanying wine arrangement served by Louise, who gave us a great introduction and explanation to the wines and food. We really had a truly amazing evening!

Top location, mostly decent, courteous and and very accommodating staff although one concierge did tell my mother that she eats too much when her wheelchair caught on a ramp and was reportedly otherwise disrespectful to her.

The air conditioning was the only option and overall, the lack of clean, fresh air made me dread returning to the hotel. The bathroom was disabled access, spacious and of a good standard, for the 1970s-'80s but really needs to be thoughtfully refurbished/modernised. More about Amsterdam

With enough art, culture, architecture, and entertainment to keep travelers coming back year after year, this Dutch city is certainly a traveler’s favorite and the cultural center of the Netherlands. Amsterdam is also the capital of Netherlands, and the largest city in the country.

The city is served by Amsterdam Schiphol Airport, which is connected to the city center through the city’s very efficient train system, as well as taxis.

This multi-faceted city is divided into several unique districts, though most travelers often end up in the central district of the old town known as Amsterdam-Centrum. This is where some of the city’s most famous and often visited attractions are located, so this area is often a favorite among travelers to the city. The Anne Frank House museum is one such attraction in this area, often crowded with tourists and history buffs who visit the place where the young Jewish diarist and her family once hid for safety during the atrocities of World War II.

Of course, Amsterdam’s nightlife is nothing short of exciting, and many travelers will go there specifically for the entertainment and music scene for which this city is so well known. But this city, full of old-world charm, is more nuanced than just exciting nightlife. This city is as suitable for backpackers and students as it is for families and the very affluent. Hotels in Amsterdam cater to every type of traveler, ranging from quaint boutique hotels in converted townhouses to purpose-built luxury establishments.

Shops and museums are laid out on a network of canals, and visitors can walk or ride a rented bicycle along the canal, over bridges and into any number of cozy sidewalk cafés or boutiques. This is the city that inspired master artists like Vincent Van Gogh, so museums and arts districts are abundant. A trip to Amsterdam is incomplete without stopping by Amsterdam Oud Zuid, an upscale southern borough known for its street markets and attractive neighborhoods. Museum Square is a popular attraction of this area, home to many well-known museums. Booking accommodation near Rijksmuseum, a world-class art institute, allows visitors to take their time exploring the galleries while spending less time getting around.

There’s much more to see in Amsterdam, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to explore where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.

LinkPoints Programme Qatar Airways Privilege Club reward-U Royal Skies Singapore Airlines KrisFlyer SkyPearl Club SM Advantage/ BDO Rewards Thai Airways Royal Orchid Plus The 1 Card Thailand TudoAzul United MileagePlus Velocity Frequent Flyer WAON POINT Featured Hotels Hotel Resort Guest House Apartment Villa NH Carlton Amsterdam 7.4 Very good Based on 240 reviews The hotel is centrally located right next to the famous flower market and to Kalverstraat, the main shopping street. My room was on the 7th floor, with a fantastic view over Mint Tower. The room was quite spacious, with a closet for clothes and a big bathroom. Being on the top floor, the street noise did not disturb me (the sound of the tower bells might be an issue for light sleepers though) but as the area around the hotel is very lively, it could be a problem in lower floor rooms. The room had tea-making facilities. Free wi-fi is now available in the hotel rooms as well as in the lobby - a password is valid for 24 hours. It was a bit slow but that could have been due to many people using it at night and in the morning. The downside was that, as many other reviews said, the furnishings looked a bit dated. The white curtains were dusty - if they have to be white, they should perhaps be washed more often. The efficiency of the daily cleaning service seemed to alternate depending on the particular person who did it - some of them did choose to clean the bathtub and the sink, others did not. All things considered, go for an upgraded room on an upper floor, and you'll be fine. Show more Svetlana , Russia Dorint Airport Hotel Amsterdam 8 Very good Based on 233 reviews The room size was a little small with lots of dirt and stains on the carpet. there were tiny hairs on the carpet. I assume, they have not vacuumed the floors in a long time. The room had a strange, musky smell, I guess it was coming from the carpet. We had a terrible experience in this hotel. Because, we had not managed to see most of Amsterdam, we decided to extend our stay there. We chose this hotel because of the price and the convenience of the shuttle service to the train station. However, after extending and informing the front desk of our extension, we then left to go to the city. when we returned to the hotel, we found over room 'ransacked'. All our belongings were crudely and roughly, packed into our suitcases and left on the baggage trolley ( like the ones you get from the supermarket). We were horrified when we saw this. We then approached the front desk to inquire about our unpleasant experience. The front desk staff was very apologetic and informed us that the system was not updated with our extension of stay. We were then asked to move to another room (which did not have the foul odour). The swimming pool was more for kids. There was a swimming instructor who was collecting fees and teaching kids to swim in that pool. It looked as if, they were on an arranged schedule and this prevented us from using the pool. The only thing we enjoyed in this hotel was the breakfast which had a wide election of food and the service here was good. Show more Usha , Malaysia Hotel Estherea 9.1 Exceptional Based on 176 reviews From the minute you enter the hotel, you are met with luxury coupled with efficiency. The hotel staff were extremely welcoming, and it provided a peaceful haven after walking around Amsterdam! We booked the cheapest room, but in no way was this basic. It was very well appointed, tastefully decorated, and the bathroom was huge! The coffee machine in reception provided extremely good coffee, wouldn't have guessed it was from a machine, and there were also chocolates, sweets and cookies available. All in all, this hotel provided a wonderful base for exploring Amsterdam. It was easy to find, right on the Singel canal, and I would definately stay there again. I cannot recommend it too much! I did not try the breakfast, so therefore cannot comment, but it did look good Show more Lee , United Kingdom Cordial Hotel Dam Square 7.1 Very good Based on 97 reviews Me and my partner visited amsterdam for 3 days - awesome experience! The hotel was roughly 4/5 min walk from Dam square and RLD Most well known coffee shops were within easy walking distance from the hotel The staff were pleasant respectful and very helpful, they also allowed us to leave our luggage after check out as we had a late flight home They provided housekeeping throughout our stay and we experienced some leaniancy with their smoking rules which made our stay feel very accommodating and comfortable as tourist The room was small room and had no view the bins in the lift area could of been changed a bit more often but it was generally clean, seemed to be great value for money and we would be happy to use this hotel in the future Would recommend staying on the 2nd floor or above Sharna , United Kingdom NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky 8.2 Excellent Based on 376 reviews Firstly, the location is superb. Right in Damn Square. It is also an iconic well known hotel. But pass through the door and expect the unexpected. Check-in was OK, although trying to find someone in the lobby to help find a powder room was a challenge. The room was in the new block, and the corridor was like a sci-fi time tunnel, with bright lights tripping on by sensor. No problem though. The room? Clean and reasonable, but plenty of corners cut. The shower was feeble, to say the least. Plugs randomly placed (none for the kettle except on the floor). The facilities were basic, and I am not too sure about the bathroom separation from main room by just frosted glass. Wifi was ok, and free, despite strong offers to buy “premium”. It wasn’t bad or anything, just that the cut corners were a bit annoying. We didn’t bother with food in there: too expensive compared to outside. Ditto breakfast. Example of the bizarre? 8am Sunday, fire alarm. A loud Dutch tannoy voice, barking orders we didn’t understand. We thought it was a bust with cops and guns outside our door. Scary, even though we had nothing to hide. We came out to see other bewildered gusts, and the fire door had bolted shut, so the only escape was the fire exit. We went down there and busted our way out. We then walked around the front of the building and through the main door. It was as if nothing had happened! We went to the lobby man, who said: not their fault because a Spanish ship’s captain had showered with the bathroom door open, and the steam had set the alarm off. Seriously. He really said that, shrugging his shoulders, saying they (the hotel) had to put up with it too. So folks, DON’T leave the shower door open, and hope no-one else does! This could be a great hotel if they got their act together, stopped cutting stupid corners with the rooms, and tried harder. Staff were ok, but the attitude from above probably sets the scene. But: iconic hotel, the advantages of large hotel, 10/10 location. jaime's wife Show more jaime , Philippines Novotel Amsterdam City 8.1 Excellent Based on 182 reviews absolutely we are coming back to this hotel when we are going to amsterdam. in fact we are planning to go to amsterdam with our kids soon and definitely this will be the hotel of our choice. near rai station and only need 5 minutes walking. taking tram will need about 20 minutes to reach central station in amsterdam or about 10 minutes by train/subway. there are taxis always stand by in front of the hotel and make much more convenience for transport. very convenience even the hotel is not in the center and we prefer to stay here as those hotels in the center will not have such facilities that this hotel can offered. the breakfast is absolutely the best you can get in amsterdam and it has been our most favourite part of the hotel. huge selections and even the best cup noodle that we ever taste. we love this selection after travelling for over a week in eu. definitely a great hotel with the best breakfast for any travellers to amsterdam. no doubt about that. i am very happy that i choose this hotel for our first time stay in amsterdam. Thanathip , Thailand NH Collection Amsterdam Barbizon Palace 8 Very good Based on 299 reviews My expectations were high from the pictures of the hotel. I knew it was an old building & that's why I selected it, but the conditions of the rooms were disappointing. We arrived at the hotel after a long overnight flight at 11:00am only to be told that the rooms are not going to be available before 3:00pm. Our cries to the front desk staff went unheard. Other rooms were available with single beds , we requested double beds, but were not given to us until our rooms were available. I have travelled throughout the world, but this was a first. When we got to the rooms, they were clean but old. the pillows were terrible, very lumpy & uncomfortable. The beds were fine as long as laid in the middle. From the Airport, take direct shuttl Show more Kelly , Malaysia Hyatt Regency Amsterdam 8.3 Excellent Based on 5 reviews easyHotel Amsterdam Zaandam 8.2 Excellent Based on 87 reviews The hotel was super close to the Zaandam train station, about a 2 minute walk, it was then a short train ride into the city centre and the frequency on the trains were every 5-10 minutes! The hotel was easy to find with the orange Easy Hotel banners outside and check in was smooth. The room was clean and tidy, and we were lucky to have an excellent view over the Zaandam train station and pretty Inntel Hotel. There was free WIFI in the rooms along with smart TVs that offer screen sharing if you have the compatible tech, (great for putting films on your phone onto a bigger screen). Don't forget to check out the leaflets next to the desk as they offer lots of discount coupons for the museums and canal tours. The only minus point we found was not having tea making facilities in the room. Even if it was just a kettle and some cups we would have happily gone and got our own tea/coffee and milk. There was a snack and cold drink vending machine on the 10th floor and a hot drink vending machine on the ground floor. But one very very small coffee was €1.50! Overall I recommend this for short stays. As space in the room is limited and there is only a small space to hang a few items of clothes. But overall a very comfortable and calm stay. So I went on the shuttle bus but realised I had left an item in my room, I asked the driver to wait so I can get my item, he said yes, when I returned he had drove off with my luggage on the bus!!!! Show more George , United Kingdom Avenue Hotel 7.5 Very good Based on 201 reviews located a mere 5 minutes walk from amsterdam centraal train station and adjacent to the main stretch of damrak, avenue hotel is a perfect choice for a stay. while the toilet was quite small, the room i was given is clean and of a nice size, although i would have liked a better view. the staff was really friendly and accommodating. when i needed to change my arrival dates (at the last minute and effectively cancelling one night of stay), the staff allowed this without penalty me which i really appreciated. i also liked that there was a computer terminal on the ground floor to check emails etc, especially useful for someone who does not travel with a laptop. all in all, i recommend this hotel to others :-) Show more Hamzah , Singapore Hotel De Hallen 8.8 Excellent Based on 119 reviews All in all, we loved our stay and would definitely stay again and highly recommend. From the moment we arrived to the moment we checked out we felt so welcome and comfortable and looked after. The rooms are very plush and comfortable, I slept incredibly well (and i'm a bad sleeper)! And i loved the coffee machines in room. We had intended to go find a restaurant for dinner but we were enjoying sitting in the lovely courtyard bit outside the bar having our complimentary cocktails (which were delicious) when an incredible looking burger was carried passed us by a waiter so we couldn't resist. My boyfriend even thinks they were the best burgers he has ever had! Technically they were on the lunch menu but the staff had no issue accommodating for dinner time and they were very reasonably priced. The hotel itself is in an old tram depo so is a really lovely space and we loved the style with several seating areas (and a swing). Despite its 'uber cool' style i found it had a really lovely atmosphere which made us feel very comfortable and we were more than happy to hang out in the communal areas. There are a couple of negatives however. It is still very new so upon our arrival we were surprised to find some areas outside the hotel still look like building sites. Not really an issue but it may bother some people. Also it is further outside of the city, this is actually why we booked it as we had tickets to a gig nearby but if you want to explore all of the city factor in that you will probably be getting the tram a lot (which is very easy, the stop is very close and again the hotel staff are very helpful advising the best way to navigate around) rather than walking. Again not a massive problem but something to bear in mind. Show more Alicia , United Kingdom Sofitel Legend The Grand Amsterdam 8.8 Excellent Based on 44 reviews We simply LOVE the Grand, and we even got married here! For our 3 year anniversary we decided to again stay here and it was truly unforgettable. The staff is very attentive and help you out with everything you need. (Niels, thanks for all your help as always!) The rooms look beautiful, very luxurious (they've got Hermes products in the bathroom) and the little personal touches are just what makes this hotel stand out from all other 5 star hotels for me. The beds are by the way amazing, and we are now tempted to actually buy the bed (new of course) as that is an option they offer! I do advise to always ask for a room at a higher floor, because if you are close to the street it may be a bit noisy. Their courtyard garden is beautiful and had a very nice exhibition of beautiful statues this time. It is so peaceful and beautiful, you do not feel like you are in the middle of Amsterdam. But the highlight was the private dinner in the marriage chamber, which is where we got married 3 years ago. A pianist (Hester, thank you so much for the lovely music and great company) was beautifully playing and the room was full of candles. So romantic! We had an amazing 7 course dinner with accompanying wine arrangement served by Louise, who gave us a great introduction and explanation to the wines and food. We really had a truly amazing evening! Show more wieneke , Netherlands Hampshire Hotel - Rembrandt Square Amsterdam 8 Very good Based on 112 reviews The check-in into the hotel was a pleasant experience like any other standard hotels. The staff member was cheerful and friendly. About an hour later, I tried to request for two adapters/sockets from the front desk and the staff member (another) was extremely rude. On check-out, I left my baggage in the hotel and upon collection, I had to wait 15 minutes for a free staff member to open the baggage room for me. Md Jamil ,Malaysia Discover the neighborhoods of Amsterdam Amsterdam-Centrum 1409 hotels Oud Zuid 335 hotels Oud-West 209 hotels Noord 104 hotels Westerpark 99 hotels Oost / Watergraafsmeer 92 hotels Zeeburg 79 hotels Amsterdam Airport 68 hotels Zuideramstel 53 hotels Zuidoost 37 hotels Slotervaart 35 hotels Bos en Lommer 31 hotels De Baarsjes 24 hotels Zaandam 24 hotels Amstelveen 22 hotels Geuzenveld / Slotermeer 21 hotels Westpoort 14 hotels Osdorp 13 hotels Badhoevedorp 2 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Hostels in Amsterdam 41 Serviced Apartments in Amsterdam 17 More about Amsterdam With enough art, culture, architecture, and entertainment to keep travelers coming back year after year, this Dutch city is certainly a traveler’s favorite and the cultural center of the Netherlands. Amsterdam is also the capital of Netherlands, and the largest city in the country. The city is served by Amsterdam Schiphol Airport , which is connected to the city center through the city’s very efficient train system, as well as taxis. This multi-faceted city is divided into several unique districts, though most travelers often end up in the central district of the old town known as Amsterdam-Centrum . This is where some of the city’s most famous and often visited attractions are located, so this area is often a favorite among travelers to the city. The Anne Frank House museum is one such attraction in this area, often crowded with tourists and history buffs who visit the place where the young Jewish diarist and her family once hid for safety during the atrocities of World War II. Of course, Amsterdam’s nightlife is nothing short of exciting, and many travelers will go there specifically for the entertainment and music scene for which this city is so well known. But this city, full of old-world charm, is more nuanced than just exciting nightlife. This city is as suitable for backpackers and students as it is for families and the very affluent. Hotels in Amsterdam cater to every type of traveler, ranging from quaint boutique hotels in converted townhouses to purpose-built luxury establishments. Shops and museums are laid out on a network of canals, and visitors can walk or ride a rented bicycle along the canal, over bridges and into any number of cozy sidewalk cafés or boutiques. This is the city that inspired master artists like Vincent Van Gogh, so museums and arts districts are abundant. A trip to Amsterdam is incomplete without stopping by Amsterdam Oud Zuid , an upscale southern borough known for its street markets and attractive neighborhoods. Museum Square is a popular attraction of this area, home to many well-known museums. Booking accommodation near Rijksmuseum, a world-class art institute, allows visitors to take their time exploring the galleries while spending less time getting around. There’s much more to see in Amsterdam, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to explore where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.
